intro: Syngramma borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean syngramma, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
